title: The Iron City of Dis

|   | A gateway to the Iron City of Dis. Who will stand the test of iron? |

[![Dis entry.png](/images/7/7e/Dis_entry.png)](/File:Dis_entry.png) **The Iron City of Dis** is the iron branch of [Hell](/Hell "Hell"), accessible from [the Vestibule of Hell](/The_Vestibule_of_Hell "The Vestibule of Hell").

## Contents

- [1 Denizens](#Denizens)

  - [1.1 General Hell monsters](#General_Hell_monsters)
  - [1.2 Branch specific](#Branch_specific)
  - [1.3 Lord](#Lord)

- [2 Contents](#Contents)
  - [2.1 Hell Effects](#Hell_Effects)

- [3 Assessment](#Assessment)

- [4 Trivia](#Trivia)

- [5 History](#History)

## Denizens

### General Hell monsters

|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                     |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 2 [![Hellion.png](/images/c/cf/Hellion.png)](/File:Hellion.png) **[Hellion](/Hellion "Hellion")** | 2 [![Tormentor.png](/images/3/3d/Tormentor.png)](/File:Tormentor.png) **[Tormentor](/Tormentor "Tormentor")** | L [![Ancient lich.png](/images/3/34/Ancient_lich.png)](/File:Ancient_lich.png) **[Ancient lich](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich")** | L [![Dread lich.png](/images/b/bc/Dread_lich.png)](/File:Dread_lich.png) **[Dread lich](/Dread_lich "Dread lich")** |

### Branch specific

|                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

### Lord

|                                                                                                         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| & [![Dispater.png](/images/f/fa/Dispater.png)](/File:Dispater.png) **[Dispater](/Dispater "Dispater")** |

## Contents

The Iron City of Dis is 7 levels deep and, true to its name, is both cosmopolitan with its demonic / undead residents and focused on iron themed. The standard hellspawn of demons and [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor") are common. Various (possibly) stair-containing vaults have [iron trolls](/Iron_troll "Iron troll"), [iron dragons](/Iron_dragon "Iron dragon"), and [quicksilver elementals](/Quicksilver_elemental "Quicksilver elemental"). On the last level, these are are joined by [war gargoyles](/War_gargoyle "War gargoyle"), [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel"), and in most ends mirrored paired guests of [brimstone fiends](/Brimstone_fiend "Brimstone fiend") and [ice fiends](/Ice_fiend "Ice fiend"). The imposing [iron giant](/Iron_giant "Iron giant") and [iron golem](/Iron_golem "Iron golem") also are essentially unique to the branch. [Crystal echidnas](/Crystal_echidna "Crystal echidna") will inflict [barbs](/Barbs "Barbs") on you, making it difficult to run away. The [the Serpent of Hell](/Serpent_of_Hell_\(Dis\) "Serpent of Hell (Dis)") is guaranteed to appear on the last level of one of the four Hells per game.

Dis contains several layouts, all of which are built out of [metal walls](/Wall#Metal "Wall"). It shares the grid-based *layout\_city*, the messy *layout\_chaotic\_city*, and the tangled gates of *layout\_gridville* with other branches, but has three unique layouts:

- **layout\_subdivisions**, which sets down a sprawling box-packed grid maze of connected open rectangular rooms
- **layout\_overlapping\_boxes**, similar to the sub\_divisions but with the occasional corner-accommodating box
- **layout\_jigsaw**, which mixes together misshapen rooms on a regular spaced-out 4x4 grid on the pointed between a connected 5x5x grid

Except for the last floor, there is no loot to be found. These floors are much smaller than regular floors, having only one exit and one way down.

The last level contains the iron [rune of Zot](/Rune_of_Zot "Rune of Zot"), guarded by & [![Dispater.png](/images/f/fa/Dispater.png)](/File:Dispater.png) **[Dispater](/Dispater "Dispater")**. Layouts include a large and straight gate standing before a castle, a densely packed city, an iron fortress with arched gates and a broad column-filled interim field, and a trio of very large arched barriers pockmarked by small asymmetrical boxes.

### Hell Effects

In addition to the universal [forces of hell](/Hell#Hell.27s_Mystical_Force "Hell"), Dis' abrasive atmosphere gives adventurers permanent [Corrosion](/Corrosion "Corrosion") (-8 [AC](/AC "AC") and [slaying](/Slaying "Slaying")) while in it, which is not affected by [corrosion resistance](/Corrosion_resistance "Corrosion resistance").

## Assessment

The Iron City of Dis has ascended over years of development from one of the easiest branches of Hell to one of the hardest. The guaranteed Hell Sentinels may lack the capability to cast Torment like [the first-tier demons](/Demon#Tier-1_Demons "Demon") of the other hell branches, but make up for it between their capability to hurl [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") and their longevity granted by high defenses and heavy resists. Iron golems have brutal melee attacks and are resistant to almost everything. While few other residents are particularly dangerous for their depth aside from regular tormentors and fiends for their [torment](/Torment "Torment") capabilities, end vaults can vary heavily in openness while packing high monster density and roundabout, winding passages.

Dis' hell effect is generally weaker than other branches; characters can afford a relatively minor (by the time you get to Dis) AC hit, and the [holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") brand is still amazingly powerful.

As with the other Hells, it is recommended to leave Dis to the end of extended endgame runs- for most characters, the only other levels of equal or further difficulty are the [Tomb](/Tomb "Tomb") and [Ziggurats](/Ziggurat "Ziggurat").

## Trivia

In Dante Alighieri's *Divine Comedy*, [Dis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dis_\(Divine_Comedy\)) is the City of the Dead, and is located in the Fifth Circle of Hell. Punished within Dis are those whose lives were marked by active (rather than passive) sins, such as heretics, murderers, suicides, thieves, and traitors. In Roman mythology, [Dispater](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dispater) was a god of the underworld, later subsumed by Pluto or Hades. Originally a chthonic god of riches, fertile agricultural land, and underground mineral wealth, he was later commonly equated with the Roman deities Pluto and Orcus, becoming an underworld deity.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), The Iron City of Dis did not corrode all adventurers who set foot in it. In addition, floors 1-6 were longer, more chaff monsters like [iron imps](/Iron_imp "Iron imp") appeared, and unique but slower hell effects occurred.
- The Iron City of Dis has had several notable changes to its themed monsters guaranteed in the vault ends. [0.11](/0.11 "0.11") replaced [pit fiends](/Pit_fiend "Pit fiend") with [hell sentinels](/Hell_sentinel "Hell sentinel"), [0.12](/0.12 "0.12") upgraded [metal gargoyles](/Metal_gargoyle "Metal gargoyle") to [war gargoyles](/War_gargoyle "War gargoyle"), and [0.16](/0.16 "0.16") shifted [iron devils](/Iron_devil "Iron devil") to [rust devils](/Rust_devil "Rust devil"). [Iron giants](/Iron_giant "Iron giant") joined the branch population in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").
- End vaults were upgraded in [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), introducing pit fiends / hell sentinels and quicksilver dragons, setting a divider wall between the entrance stairs and the castle in older layouts, and bringing in the famously monster-heavy box-based layout of *dis\_st* that served as a design influence for future Dis end vaults.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), Dis (and the other Hell branches) blocked [teleport control](/Teleport_control "Teleport control").

html:
The Iron City of Dis

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
The Iron City of Dis is home to many of the most resilient guardians of hell. Those who do not belong in the halls of Dis will find the very earth itself opposing them.

The malice of this metal realm corrodes equipment.

Dis is seven levels deep and contains the iron rune of Zot. It can be accessed via the Vestibule of Hell.

A gateway to the Iron City of Dis. Who will stand the test of iron?

The Iron City of Dis is the iron branch of Hell, accessible from the Vestibule of Hell.

Contents

  • 1 Denizens
    • 1.1 General Hell monsters
    • 1.2 Branch specific
    • 1.3 Lord
  • 2 Contents
    • 2.1 Hell Effects
  • 3 Assessment
  • 4 Trivia

Denizens

General Hell monsters

2 Hellion 2 Tormentor L Ancient lich L Dread lich

Branch specific

z Ancient champion 9 War gargoyle D Iron dragon 9 Iron golem b Caustic shrike
E Quicksilver elemental r Crystal echidna 1 Hell sentinel C Iron giant

Lord

& Dispater

Contents

The Iron City of Dis is 7 levels deep and, true to its name, is both cosmopolitan with its demonic / undead residents and focused on iron themed. The standard hellspawn of demons and tormentors are common. Various (possibly) stair-containing vaults have iron trolls, iron dragons, and quicksilver elementals. On the last level, these are are joined by war gargoyles, hell sentinels, and in most ends mirrored paired guests of brimstone fiends and ice fiends. The imposing iron giant and iron golem also are essentially unique to the branch. Crystal echidnas will inflict barbs on you, making it difficult to run away. The the Serpent of Hell is guaranteed to appear on the last level of one of the four Hells per game.

Dis contains several layouts, all of which are built out of metal walls. It shares the grid-based layout_city, the messy layout_chaotic_city, and the tangled gates of layout_gridville with other branches, but has three unique layouts:

  • layout_subdivisions, which sets down a sprawling box-packed grid maze of connected open rectangular rooms
  • layout_overlapping_boxes, similar to the sub_divisions but with the occasional corner-accommodating box
  • layout_jigsaw, which mixes together misshapen rooms on a regular spaced-out 4x4 grid on the pointed between a connected 5x5x grid

Except for the last floor, there is no loot to be found. These floors are much smaller than regular floors, having only one exit and one way down.

The last level contains the iron rune of Zot, guarded by & Dispater. Layouts include a large and straight gate standing before a castle, a densely packed city, an iron fortress with arched gates and a broad column-filled interim field, and a trio of very large arched barriers pockmarked by small asymmetrical boxes.

Hell Effects

In addition to the universal forces of hell, Dis' abrasive atmosphere gives adventurers permanent Corrosion (-8 AC and slaying) while in it, which is not affected by corrosion resistance.

Assessment

The Iron City of Dis has ascended over years of development from one of the easiest branches of Hell to one of the hardest. The guaranteed Hell Sentinels may lack the capability to cast Torment like the first-tier demons of the other hell branches, but make up for it between their capability to hurl damnation and their longevity granted by high defenses and heavy resists. Iron golems have brutal melee attacks and are resistant to almost everything. While few other residents are particularly dangerous for their depth aside from regular tormentors and fiends for their torment capabilities, end vaults can vary heavily in openness while packing high monster density and roundabout, winding passages.

Dis' hell effect is generally weaker than other branches; characters can afford a relatively minor (by the time you get to Dis) AC hit, and the holy wrath brand is still amazingly powerful.

As with the other Hells, it is recommended to leave Dis to the end of extended endgame runs- for most characters, the only other levels of equal or further difficulty are the Tomb and Ziggurats.

Trivia

In Dante Alighieri's Divine Comedy, Dis is the City of the Dead, and is located in the Fifth Circle of Hell. Punished within Dis are those whose lives were marked by active (rather than passive) sins, such as heretics, murderers, suicides, thieves, and traitors. In Roman mythology, Dispater was a god of the underworld, later subsumed by Pluto or Hades. Originally a chthonic god of riches, fertile agricultural land, and underground mineral wealth, he was later commonly equated with the Roman deities Pluto and Orcus, becoming an underworld deity.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, The Iron City of Dis did not corrode all adventurers who set foot in it. In addition, floors 1-6 were longer, more chaff monsters like iron imps appeared, and unique but slower hell effects occurred.
  • The Iron City of Dis has had several notable changes to its themed monsters guaranteed in the vault ends. 0.11 replaced pit fiends with hell sentinels, 0.12 upgraded metal gargoyles to war gargoyles, and 0.16 shifted iron devils to rust devils. Iron giants joined the branch population in 0.18.
  • End vaults were upgraded in 0.11, introducing pit fiends / hell sentinels and quicksilver dragons, setting a divider wall between the entrance stairs and the castle in older layouts, and bringing in the famously monster-heavy box-based layout of dis_st that served as a design influence for future Dis end vaults.
  • Prior to 0.17, Dis (and the other Hell branches) blocked teleport control.
